pointsOfInterest.shortDescription: The climb begins. Watch the Duars plains fade as you enter the steep Himalayan foothills.
Manicured tea slopes and the famous 'Rock Viewpoint' featuring massive roadside boulders.
Crossing the scenic Dudhia Bridge over the wide, rocky Balason riverbed.
The famous 'Snake Road.' Look back to see the road looping like a ribbon below.
Kurseong's highest point. 360° views stretching from Siliguri plains to the high peaks.
Overlooking the Teesta River from the quiet, emerald slopes of Munsong village.
The vibrant Samdrup Darjay Choling Monastery, a colorful spiritual landmark.
A misty tunnel of Himalayan Pine (Dhupi) trees where the sun rarely touches the road.
Deep, ancient forests home to the rare and prehistoric Himalayan Salamander.
The iconic railway spiral, War Memorial, and the grand opening of the mountain vista.
The finale: The world’s third-highest peak towering over Darjeeling.
